name: Optical Communications and Networks
description: This course provides an introduction to optical communication systems and networks at the system and functional level.  Applications range from telecommunication networks (short to long haul) to computing networks (chip-to-chip, on chip communications, optical backplanes).  Basic principles of optical transmission and associated components used for transmission of light and optical networks; system design tools for optical links; multi-service system requirements; optical network design tools (routing and wavelength assignment), network management and survivability.
department: Edward S. Rogers Sr. Dept. of Electrical & Computer Engin.
